intro: Elytranthe ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's elytranthe, is a small, flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically borne on a spike above the leaf rosette. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
